get.description: Returns a paged list of businesses controlled by the partner. The API returns up to 30 businesses per request. Results are sorted by external_id.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

post.description:
Creates or updates a business. It does this by looking up the business by external_id, if it cannot find that business it creates it. If you would rather an error is returned when a business does not exist, use the Update method.
All new businesses are created in a pending state. The corresponding BRP will not be accessible until the business has been activated.

parameters.name: show_hours
parameters.description: a boolean value indicating whether to display a business’ operating hours on their BRP. 1 and 0 can be used for True and False respectively.

parameters.name: address[municipality]
parameters.description: would correspond to City for US-based addresses

parameters.name: address[region]
parameters.description: For US, provide the 2-letter state abbreviation

parameters.name: address[postcode]
parameters.description: Zip code

parameters.name: address[country]
parameters.description: The two letter country code (ISO 3166 Alpha-2)

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: this is a public email address for contacting the business

business.name: Gates Auto Body Alphorn
business.about: Gates Auto Body Alphorn offers excellence in collision repairs.  We ensure quality workmanship and customers enjoy our convenient, comfortable and state-of-the-art collision center.

get.description: Returns current detailed information for a partner business.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

put.description: Updates an existing business. Returns an error if the business can not be found.

delete.description: Completely removes a pending business. This method will only work with pending businesses. Once a business has been activated it can only be deactivated, not permanently deleted.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

put.description: Activate a pending or deactivated business.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
Returns the current business hours.

This resource allows for the maintenance of a business’ displayed operating hours. For every day of the week, each business can either be “closed” or have up to two start and end times. For the purposes of this API, day of the week is expressed as an integer between 0 and 6 where 0 = Monday, 1 = Tuesday, ..., 6 = Sunday. All time parameters should be passed in the format HH:MM using a 24-hour clock. Time zones are not used for these display purposes.

put.description: Populates new business hours for this business.

parameters.name: hours[​day_of_week]​[closed]
parameters.description: a boolean value indicating the business is open or closed on this day - 0 and 1 would be open and closed respectively.

parameters.name: hours[​day_of_week]​[start_time_1]
parameters.description: the start time in HH:MM format

parameters.name: hours[​day_of_week]​[end_time_1]
parameters.description: the end time

parameters.name: hours[​day_of_week]​[start_time_2]
parameters.description: the start time

parameters.name: hours[​day_of_week][end_time_2]
parameters.description: the end time

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
Returns a list of users who can control this business

This resource allows for the creation and authorization of users to administer a business via the SureCritic website. Users within SureCritic are identified by their email address. When granting
a user rights to a given business, the API will create the user if it does not exist in the database. Removing a user’s rights to a business does not remove them from SureCritic, only their rights to administer that business.

post.description: Grants the user rights to administer this business. The user will be emailed to notify them of their new status. Existing users under this partner account can be added to a business just by passing the external id. If it is desired to add or create users, pass email and name fields in addition to the external id.

parameters.name: ​email_address
parameters.description: the email address of the user to be granted rights. It can be omitted if passing ​external_id ​of a user already created under this partner account.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: an identifier that allows you to later update attributes of this user via the Users Resource. Can be used in lieu of ​email_address ​when adding existing users.

delete.description: Removes a user's rights to administer this business.

parameters.name: email_address
parameters.description: the email address of the user whose rights are to be removed

parameters.name: external_business_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

business_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
business_reviews.comments: My son had his car recently repaired from hitting a deer and the repairs were done in only two days. The car looks great and they gave us a free loaner. Found out my son left the garage door opener in the car and contacted them thru website chat forum. Then received a call that Sunday that they located it and we could come in to pick it up great customer service. So glad our insurance company recommended them

Leslie said Jerry at this business did a great job explaining everything step by step regarding the vehicle repairs. Everything was done exactly as stated every step of the way. He couldn't have asked for better service.
Randy said they answered all of his questions and explained everything to him well. He knew exactly how long his repair would take.
Robin said this business did a good job in a timely manner and she has no complaints.
Tom said the business did an excellent job and they were great.

get.description:
Returns a paged list of reviews controlled by the partner business. The API returns up to 30 reviews per request. Results are sorted by created_date ascending.

This is the primary interface for creating reviews within the SureCritic API. Reviews are identified by your own unique identifier referred to as the external_id. The external_id, as well as the business_external_id, is required whenever creating reviews.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1.

parameters.name: ​page_size
parameters.description: The number of reviews returned in the query.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: optional filter allowing only reviews since the given date. It should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. The since parameter is inclusive of the passed date.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: optional filter allowing only reviews before the given date. It should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. The parameter is exclusive of the passed date.

parameters.name: customer_external_id
parameters.description: filter reviews by customer

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: the external id of the review.

parameters.name: rating
parameters.description: the overall rating as a value between 1 and 5

parameters.name: recommends
parameters.description: a boolean value indicating whether the reviewer would recommend the business to a friend. 0 and 1 are used for “does not recommend” and “recommends” respectively.

parameters.name: comments
parameters.description: text of the review

parameters.name: ​first_name
parameters.description: the customer/reviewer’s first name

parameters.name: ​last_name
parameters.description: the customer/reviewer’s last name

parameters.name: email_address
parameters.description: the customer/reviewer’s email address

parameters.name: municipality
parameters.description: city or township of the customer/reviewer

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: of the customer/reviewer; for US, use the 2-letter state abbreviation

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: zip code of the customer/reviewer

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The two letter country code (ISO 3166 Alpha-2). defaults to US.

parameters.name: review_date
parameters.description: the date the review was created in the format YYYY-MM-DD, this defaults to the current date

parameters.name: service_date
parameters.description: the date of service in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: service_performed
parameters.description: the short description of the service performed, such as “Collision Repair”

parameters.name: service_order_id
parameters.description: an identifier for the business/partner to indicate which visit the review corresponds to.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The Model Year of the vehicle/item serviced

parameters.name: make
parameters.description: The Make of the vehicle/item serviced
The Model of the vehicle/item serviced
parameters.name: model
original_review_id
parameters.description: if creating a ReScore review, pass the id of the original review

parameters.name: third_person
parameters.description: a boolean value indicating whether the review was written in third person prose. Defaults to 0 (first person).

parameters.name: department_id
parameters.description: a numeric value to support business that have more than one department. Current values include sales = 1, service = 2, collision = 3.

parameters.name: custom_fields[​field_identifier]​
parameters.description: a value for any partner-specific custom fields, replacing ​field_identifier w​ ith the appropriate value. Multiple custom fields can be specified.

parameters.name: external_business_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: external_review_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the review

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

review.comments: Leslie said Jerry at this business did a great job explaining everything step by step regarding the vehicle repairs. Everything was done exactly as stated every step of the way. He couldn't have asked for better service.

parameters.name: external_business_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format

get.description:
Returns a paged list of feedback requests for the partner business. The API returns up to 30 feedback requests per request. Results are sorted by created_date descending.

This is the primary interface for creating feedback requests within the SureCritic API. Feedback requests encompass ReviewReach requests, and will include standard review requests in the future.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1.

parameters.name: ​page_size
parameters.description: The number of feedback requests returned in the query.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: optional filter allowing only feedback requests since the given date. It should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. The since parameter is inclusive of the passed date.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: optional filter allowing only feedback requests before the given date. It should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD. The parameter is exclusive of the passed date.

parameters.name: contact_external_id
parameters.description: filter requests by customer

parameters.name: contact_external_id
parameters.description: an external identifier for this customer

parameters.name: ​first_name
parameters.description: the customer/reviewer’s first name

parameters.name: ​last_name
parameters.description: the customer/reviewer’s last name

parameters.name: email_address
parameters.description: the customer/reviewer’s email address

parameters.name: municipality
parameters.description: city or township of the customer/reviewer

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: of the customer/reviewer; for US, use the 2-letter state abbreviation

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: zip code of the customer/reviewer

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The Model Year of the vehicle/item serviced

parameters.name: make
parameters.description: The Make of the vehicle/item serviced
The Model of the vehicle/item serviced
parameters.name: model
department_id
parameters.description: a numeric value to support business that have more than one department. Current values include sales = 1, service = 2, collision = 3.

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: ​the phone number for the customer

parameters.name: transaction_external_id
parameters.description: an identifier for the business/partner to indicate which visit the review corresponds to. For example, the service order id or repair order id.

parameters.name: transaction_amount
parameters.description: the dollar amount of the related transaction

parameters.name: ​transaction_description
parameters.description: a string description of the transaction

parameters.name: vin
parameters.description: The vehicle identification number or serial number for the product referenced

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The two letter country code (ISO 3166 Alpha-2). defaults to US.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

In the parameter names shown below you will see the prefix ​rr[​n​] ​on each parameter name. Replace ​n w​ ith the 0-based index of the parameter group.

parameters.name: format

get.description: Returns a paged list of review request batch files created by the partner. The API returns up to 30 review request batches per HTTP request. Results are sorted by batch id.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1.

post.description: Creates a review request batch file for processing.

parameters.name: ​file_uri
parameters.description: the location of the file to be downloaded

parameters.name: receipt_uri
parameters.description: a location to upload a receipt file. The receipt file will include the request codes and URLs for each review request created

parameters.name: callback_uri
parameters.description: an URL to be called as an HTTP GET request once processing is complete.

parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the batch file

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description: Returns current detailed information for a review request batch file, including whether it has been processed and the number of requests created. Included will be a processing state that can be either “queued, processing, finished, or canceled”.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
Returns a list of categories in SureCritic.
  
This resource allows you to look up the appropriate category codes available in SureCritic.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
Returns a list of users administered by this account. The API returns up to 30 users per request. Results are sorted by external_id.

This resource allows you to manipulate users within the control of your account. Users created via this resource will be considered pending. They will not receive an email notification to activate their account until they have been added to a business.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1

post.description:
Creates or updates a user. It does this by looking up the user by external_id, if it cannot find that user it creates it. If you would rather an error is returned when a user does not exist, use the Update method.

All new users are created in a pending state. The new user will not receive an email for verification until they have been granted access to at least one business.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The external_id of the user

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description: Returns detailed info on the user with the given external_id.

put.description: Updates an existing user. Returns an error if the user can not be found.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

200.description: The user with the passed email address exists.

404.description: The user with the passed email address does not exist.

parameters.name: email_address
parameters.description: the email address

get.description: A simple method to see if a user exists with the passed email address. It works for all SureCritic users, not just those controlled by the partner. It will return a 200 if a user with the passed email address does exist and a 404 if they do not.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The external_id of the user

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

put.description: Sends a user an email with instructions for activating their SureCritic account. Only applies to pending users.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: The external_id of the user

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

put.description: Sends a user an email with instructions for resetting their SureCritic account. Only applies to active users.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
Returns the highest priority request for the contact. It will return

This resource allows you to query the SureCritic database to see if a VIN/email address has any existing requests for feedback. These requests can range from a review request, a ReScore request, Low Score Diagnostic, or even a Vehicle Review. The resource will return the highest priority request. Separate permission must be granted to your API key by SureCritic to use this resource.

parameters.name: vin
parameters.description: The vehicle identification number for the contact

parameters.name: email_address
parameters.description: The email address of the contact

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
​Returns a paged list of third party reviews per requested business. The API returns up to 30 third party reviews per request. Results are sorted by published date descending.

This resource allows you to query the SureCritic database for reviews from third parties (Google, Yelp, BING, etc). Separate permission must be granted to your API key by SureCritic to use this resource. Businesses are identified by your own unique identifier referred to as the external_id.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for your business

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description: Returns a paged list of summaries for third party reviews per requested business. The API returns a total summary and then a summary for each external source.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
Returns a list of third party sources in SureCritic.

This resource allows you to look up the appropriate Third Party Source codes available in SureCritic.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
Returns a paged list of surveys controlled by the partner. Only live surveys are returned. The API returns up to 100 surveys per request. Results are sorted by created_date ascending.


This is the primary interface for listing your surveys within the SureCritic API. Surveys are identified by our internal id, which can be obtained via the List Method. Each Survey will contain the following fields:
● ​survey_id ​- SureCritic’s identifier for this survey

parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1.
parameters.name: page
page_size
parameters.description: The number of surveys returned in the query.

parameters.name: survey_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the survey

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description: Returns current detailed information for a specific survey. It includes information including individual nodes, questions, and options. A node is the equivalent of a screen of questions.

parameters.name: survey_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for this survey

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: XML or JSON

get.description:
Returns a paged list of survey responses created by the partner. The API returns up to 30 survey responses per HTTP request. Results are sorted by survey_response_id.

Survey Responses are used to create a custom link for a customer to complete their Survey online. Customer and service information is provided at the time a Survey Response is created. Each Survey Response created will contain the following fields:
● ​survey_response_id ​- SureCritic’s identifier for this survey_response
● ​request_url ​- the one-time use URL for completing this review

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for the request. The default page is 1.

parameters.name: business_external_id
parameters.description: A business identifier to restrict survey responses. Not all surveys will tie responses to a business.

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: if a value is present, the response will only include completed survey responses

parameters.name: not_complete
parameters.description: if a value is present, the response will only include incomplete survey responses

parameters.name: show_answers
parameters.description: if the value is = “true”, the response will include the answers for completed survey responses. This is best combined with the ​complete parameter

parameters.name: surecritic_sends_email
parameters.description: a boolean flag (0 or 1, defaulting to 1) indicating whether SC is managing the email.

parameters.name: service_order_id
parameters.description: an identifier for the business/partner to indicate which visit we are request the review of.

parameters.name: business_external_id
parameters.description: external id indicating a particular business.

parameters.name: department_id
parameters.description: a numeric value to support business that have more than one department. Current values include sales = 1, service = 2, collision = 3.

parameters.name: internal_pay
parameters.description: a boolean flag (0 or 1, defaulting to 0)

parameters.name: external_deparment_id
parameters.description: for customer use, to indicate their department id.

parameters.name: external_service_type
parameters.description: for customer use, to indicate their service type.

parameters.name: service_order_amount
parameters.description: dollar amount of transaction.

parameters.name: serviced_on
parameters.description: date of service, format YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: mobile_number
parameters.description: should accept text messages

parameters.description: city or township

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: for US, use the 2-letter state abbreviation

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: zip code

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The two letter country code (ISO 3166 Alpha-2). defaults to US.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: customer id for this transaction.

parameters.name: vin
parameters.description: VIN of the vehicle.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The Model Year of the vehicle/item serviced, format YYYY

parameters.name: make
parameters.description: The Make of the vehicle/item serviced

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The Model of the vehicle/item serviced

parameters.name: purchased_on
parameters.description: purchase date, format YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: custom_fields[​field_identifier]​
parameters.description: a value for any partner-specific custom fields, replacing ​field_identifier w​ ith the appropriate value. Multiple custom fields can be specified.

parameters.name: survey_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the survey

parameters.name: survey_response_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the survey response

parameters.name: format
